citation.article-title: Ulvibacter litoralis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from the green alga Ulva fenestrata
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ulvibacter litoralis sp. nov.
Ulvibacter litoralis (li.to.ra′lis. L. masc. adj. litoralis of the shore, a shallow-water dweller).
Main characteristics are as given for the genus.
In addition, cells range from 0·4 to 0·5 μm in width and from 2·5 to 7·3 μm in length.
On marine agar, colonies are 2–4 mm in diameter, circular, convex, shiny with entire edges, viscous and yellow–orange in colour.
Gelatin, Tweens 20 and 40 and DNA are decomposed.
Agar, casein, alginate, starch, Tween 80, cellulose (CM-cellulose and filter paper) and chitin are not hydrolysed.
No acid is formed from cellobiose, fucose, galactose, melibiose, raffinose, rhamnose, xylose, adonitol, dulcitol or glycerol.
Arabinose, glucose, lactose, mannose, maltose, sucrose, mannitol, inositol, sorbitol, malonate, citrate, N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate, caprate, adipate, malate and phenylacetate are not utilized.
Production of indole, H2S and acetoin (Voges–Proskauer reaction) is negative.
Isolated from the green alga Ulva fenestrata.
